title: Exploring Informal Learning by Instructional Designers: Qualitative Research-Based Practice Case Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of instructional design theories and practical experience
context.additional_context: Conducted in an offline classroom setting with smartphone-based supplementary materials, focusing on in-depth discussions and case analyses grounded in educational field experiences

learning_goals: Learners can classify informal learning types into eight or more categories through practical instructional design case studies.
Learners can analyze and interpret tacit learning patterns in educational settings using qualitative research methodologies.
Learners can propose three or more practical problem-solving strategies for challenges encountered in the instructional design process.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
